intro: Azalea makinoi, commonly known as the Japanese azalea, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Rhododendron genus and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its colorful blooms. Azalea makinoi thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
